main_definition: To allow or permit something to happen, often by not interfering.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Allowing someone to leave a place.
meanings_and_examples.example: When the door was left open, she took advantage of letting her friends out.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not stopping or preventing something from happening.
meanings_and_examples.example: He continued with his work even though it started raining; he wasn't letting the rain stop him.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refraining from taking action, often when one has control over a situation.
meanings_and_examples.example: Even though she had power to close down the factory, she decided not to let it happen and allowed operations to continue temporarily.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Granting permission or approval for something.
meanings_and_examples.example: Her parents were letting her go on a trip with friends because they trusted them.
